result.execSummary:
The defendant CURTIS J. CLOUD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments except for employment purposes. No possession of alcohol or drug para. AODA assesment and follow through. Certified Batters counseling. Parenting classes. Other counseling as recommended by agent. No contact with A.R.M., her residence, any residence temporarily occupied by her, or her place of employment. Full Time employment or 5 job searches per week. No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license and or valid insurance

8:51 AM Defendant CURTIS J. CLOUD in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for CURTIS J. CLOUD.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters N.C. plea to counts 1 and 2. Remaining counts will be DRI. Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.
